chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:02 PM - 22 CF 03, 22 CF 27, 21 CM 96 - Defendant Dean Warren Hermosillo in court with attorney Jon Padgham.  Defendant Dean Warren Hermosillo in custody.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  22 CF 3} PH - Scott Hultman, sworn - Exam ADA, Ex #1 (BB w/attachmts fr Iron Co Case), Cross Atty Padgham, Closing by Atty.  Ct finds PC def com fel in Ash Co, bound over for argnmt.  22 CF 27} Gary Fox, sworn - Exam ADA, Ex #1 (BB w/attachmts fr Iron Co Case), Cross Atty Padgham, Closing Atty Padghan.  Ct finds PC def com fel in Ash Co, bound over for argnmt.  Info's will be filed next wk.  Req Judge to recuse himself because of former prosecutor & is denied.  St 30 days to file info, ct will schedule argnmt & wait to see if sub of judge is filed.  Parties may ZOOM next dte, JA make arrangmts for def to appear next dte. 21 CM 96 - INIT is completed & this case will stay w/Judge McK (JA please set up def to appear).  Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
